Taylor,
 
It certainly makes sense to check. Yes, JUnit 3 tests will be supported into
the foreseeable future.
 
Regards,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
smile_y_face
Sent: Monday, February 25, 2008 1:01 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit 3 Continued Support



Hi,

I am fairly new to JUnit and am on a development team that is about to
start using JUnit. We are considering writing our initial tests with
JUnit 3 (which we think will cooperate better with our current
environment) and then adding tests in JUnit 4 later if we decide it
will better meet our needs at that time.

Before making the time investment to write our tests, we want to make
sure that the style of tests associated with JUnit 3 will not be
sunset any time in the near future in favor of exclusively using the
new tag-style implementation.

Will JUnit 3 continue to be supported for the foreseeable future?

Thanks much!

Taylor
